opendial.datastructs

Class Assignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.datastructs.Assignment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WeightedSample

    public class Assignment
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of an assignment of variables (expressed via their unique identifiers) to specific values. The assignment is logically represented as a conjunction of (variable,value) pairs.

    Technically, the assignment is encoded as a map between the variable identifiers and their associated value. This class offers various methods are provided for creating, comparing and manipulating such assignments.

    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-03-20 21:16:08 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

        public Assignment(java.lang.String booleanAssign)
        Creates an assignment with a single pair, given a boolean assignment such as "Variable" or "!Variable". If booleanAssign start with an exclamation mark, the value is set to false, else the value is set to true.
        Parameters:
        booleanAssign - the boolean assignment

      • consistentWith

        public boolean consistentWith(Assignment a)
        Returns true if the two assignments are mutually consistent, i.e. if there is a label l which appears in both assignment, then their value must be equal.
        Parameters:
        a - the second assignment
        Returns:
        true if assignments are consistent, false otherwise

        public boolean isDefault()

        Returns:
        true if all variables have none values, false otherwise
